Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Temporin-CPa (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals, UCLL1c; XXA)
Sequence Information.Source: the New World frogLithobates capito, North America

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against E. coli (MIC 25 uM), S. aureus (50 uM), and C. albicans (25 uM). In addiiton, it is also active against S. epidermidis (MIC 12.5 uM), B. subtilis (MIC 50 uM), K. pneumoniae (MIC 50 uM), G. Glabrata (MIC 12.5 uM), and C. tropicalis (MIC 3.1-6.2 uM)  (Mishra Wang et al. 2018).Toxicity: It displayed hemo.lytic activity (human red blood cells) at LC50=220 uM (confirmed 5/2020). Updated 5/2018.
Literature Information.Author: Conlon JM, Meetani MA, Coquet L, Jouenne T, Leprince J, Vaudry H, Kolodziejek J, Nowotny N, King JD2009
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial peptides from the skin secretions of the New World frogs Lithobates capito and Lithobates warszewitschii (Ranidae).
